title: Peterborough 4-0 Doncaster: Match Report
text: Peterborough 4-0 Doncaster: Match Report 24 Oct 2015 17:01:00 Peterborough run riot against Doncaster to wreck Darren Ferguson's returnThe most successful manager in Peterborough's history suffered a miserable return as Doncaster were demolished 4-0.Darren Ferguson, who guided Posh to three promotions and a Johnstone's Paint Trophy across two spells as boss, saw his new Rovers charges torn apart by Graham Westley's hosts.Two players signed by Ferguson combined for the opening goal as Erhun Oztumer's corner was headed in by Gaby Zakuani on nine minutes.And Turkish ace Oztumer went from provider to scorer when doubling Posh's advantage nine minutes before the break with a cushioned finish from the edge of the box after being picked out by Souleymane Coulibaly.Ferguson's hopes of a Rovers comeback were dashed two minutes into the second period as on-loan left-back Callum Elder fired the first goal of his career to increase Posh's lead and they were put out of their misery by a fine 25-yard strike from Conor Washington - another Ferguson recruit - with 17 minutes to go.Michael Bostwick hacked a Butler header off the line and the post kept out a Nathan Tyson effort as Rovers drew a blank.
